question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find all real numbers $x$ between 0 and 360 such that $\sqrt{3} \cos 10^\circ = \cos 40^\circ + \sin x^\circ.$  Enter all the solutions, separated by commas.
ground_truth:
We have that
\begin{align*}
\sin x^\circ &= \sqrt{3} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \\
&= 2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ - \cos (10^\circ + 30^\circ).
\end{align*}From the angle addition formula,
\begin{align*}
2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ - \cos (10^\circ + 30^\circ) &= 2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ - (\cos 10^\circ \cos 30^\circ - \sin 10^\circ \sin 30^\circ) \\
&= \cos 10^\circ \cos 30^\circ + \sin 10^\circ \sin 30^\circ.
\end{align*}From the angle subtraction formula,
\begin{align*}
\cos 10^\circ \cos 30^\circ + \sin 10^\circ \sin 30^\circ &= \cos (30^\circ - 10^\circ) \\
&= \cos 20^\circ \\
&= \sin 70^\circ.
\end{align*}The solutions are then $\boxed{70,110}.$

question:
$$\sqrt{3} \cos 10^\circ = \cos 40^\circ + \sin x^\circ$$

$$\sqrt{3} \left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \frac{1}{2} \sin 10^\circ \right) = \cos 40^\circ + \sin x^\circ$$

$$\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \sin 10^\circ = \cos 40^\circ + \sin x^\circ$$

$$\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ = \sin x^\circ + \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \sin 10^\circ$$

$$\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ = \sin \left(x^\circ + \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \sin 10^\circ \right)$$

$$\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ = \sin \left(x^\circ + 30^\circ \right)$$

$$x^\circ + 30^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right)$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) - 30^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) - 30^\circ + 360^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 330^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 330^\circ + 360^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 690^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 1050^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 1410^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 1770^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 2130^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 2490^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 2850^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 3210^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 3570^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 3930^\circ$$

$$x^\circ = \sin^{-1} \left(\frac{3}{2} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \right) + 4
There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
ground_truth:
We have that
\begin{align*}
\sin x^\circ &= \sqrt{3} \cos 10^\circ - \cos 40^\circ \\
&= 2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ - \cos (10^\circ + 30^\circ).
\end{align*}From the angle addition formula,
\begin{align*}
2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ - \cos (10^\circ + 30^\circ) &= 2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ - (\cos 10^\circ \cos 30^\circ - \sin 10^\circ \sin 30^\circ) \\
&= \cos 10^\circ \cos 30^\circ + \sin 10^\circ \sin 30^\circ.
\end{align*}From the angle subtraction formula,
\begin{align*}
\cos 10^\circ \cos 30^\circ + \sin 10^\circ \sin 30^\circ &= \cos (30^\circ - 10^\circ) \\
&= \cos 20^\circ \\
&= \sin 70^\circ.
\end{align*}The solutions are then $\boxed{70,110}.$
